result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M Erdmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Judge Slate from Wisconsin Department of Corrections dated 11/29/2018 re: sentence credit

Judgment of Conviction and Notice of Entry of Judgment sent to the defendant C/O Outagamie County Jail has been returned.  Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to Forward.  Sent to defendant C/O Green Lake County Jail
of Sentencing after Revocation hearing held on September 18, 2018, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

1:03 P.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Brittany Running.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Running - has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing statement by Atty Running.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF8 - Count 1 & 2 (EACH) 3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision.  Concurrent to each other.
2014CF9 - 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.  Concurrent to the sentence on 2014CF8.
2017CF83 - 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision.  Consecutive to any other sentence.

Court orders the court costs be reduced to civil judgements:

2014CF8
Ct 1 - Court Costs $591.50 and Restitution of $831.11.
Ct 2 - Court Costs $518.00.

2014CF9
Ct 1 - Court Costs $518.00.

2017CF83
Ct 1 - Court Costs $518.00.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP and SAP programs.
Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of:

2014CF8 - 380 days.
2014CF9 - 204 days.
2017CF83 - 188 days.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 18, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
(Atty Brittany Running)

from the victims requesting the No Contact provision be removed

10:21 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Haase recites agreement - 2014CF8 defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2. 2014CF9 - defendant will plea to count 1. 2014CF10 - defendant will plea to count 1.  2014CM27 and 2014CF86 are to be dismissed and read-in and parties request a PSI.  ADA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 & 2 on 2014CF8, count 1 on 2014CF9 & count 1 on 2014CF10.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 on 2014CF10, count 1 on 2014.  Court orders the balance of the counts and 2014CM27 & 2014CF86 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days and sentencing is to be scheduled thereafter.  

Statement by ADA - has received correspondence from the victims requesting bond be modified on 2014CF8 to allow contact with the victims.  Court amends the bond to allow contact.  All other conditions remain the same.

Statement by Atty Haase - defendant's mother is here and would like to say something.  Statement by Carla in regards to the bond - requests it be returned back to her.  No objection by ADA on 14CF10 to convert to a signature bond.  No obection by Atty Haase.  Court amends bond on 14CF10 to a $500 signature bond and the cash bond be returned to the poster.

Court adjourned at 10:33 a.m.
Fond du lac County Jail - 11/11/2014 at 9:30 a.m. (Plea Hearing)
from Atty Haase dated October 23, 2014 - defendant is still incarcerated in the FDL County Jail, a writ will be needed for the plea hearing scheduled on 11/04.
Status hearing on November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.
